DOC.brief_title: Study Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation ( rTMS ) Adjuvant Treatment Depression
DOC.detailed_description: This first study kind systematically investigate use repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) non-remitters selective serotonin-reuptake inhibitor ( SSRI ) follow serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor ( SNRI ) trial capacity identify gene variant predict rTMS response . The study similar design STAR*D study third treatment stage study subject major depressive disorder ( MDD ) . rTMS novel intervention FDA approve treatment MDD October 2008 clinically available time STAR*D study . The primary aim pilot study provide 10 Hertz ( Hz ) repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) apply left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex ( L-DLPFC ) adjuvant treatment depression individual remission depressive symptom 8 week trial SSRI ( citalopram escitalopram ) follow 8 week trial SNRI , duloxetine identify gene variant associate improvement depressive symptom .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Subjects whose depressive symptom remit participation `` Pharmacokinetics Pharmacodynamics Citalopram Escitalopram '' study `` Pharmacokinetics Pharmacodynamics Duloxetine '' study Must able continue take dose duloxetine course study Exclusion Criteria A history failure respond Electroconvulsive Therapy ( ECT ) Any metal head ( except mouth ) Implanted medication pump cardiac pacemaker Have prior brain surgery Have unprovoked seizure disorder family history treatment resistant epilepsy Pregnancy Psychiatric hospitalization within past two week Suicide attempt hospitalization within past three month
